content.query:
SELECT 
*
FROM 
OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://newsynapseadlsaccount.dfs.core.windows.net/newsynapsefilesys/raw-data/Data/customerData.txt',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
) AS [result]


SELECT
ProductName, SUM(CustomerAmount)
FROM
OPENROWSET(
    BULK  'https://newsynapseadlsaccount.dfs.core.windows.net/newsynapsefilesys/raw-data/Data/FactCustomer.txt',
    FORMAT = 'CSV',
    HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
    PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
) AS [result]

GROUP by ProductName

SELECT
    NOC,
    APPROX_COUNT_DISTINCT(Discipline) AS uniqueDiscipline,
    SUM(Gold) AS GoldTotal,
    SUM(Silver) AS SilverTotal,
    SUM(Bronze) AS BronzeTotal
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://newsynapseadlsaccount.dfs.core.windows.net/newsynapsefilesys/transformed-data/part-00000-cf1e67ff-53ca-48a2-b7d0-9ad1d11f12df-c000.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) WITH (
        [Name] VARCHAR(100),
        NOC VARCHAR(100),
        Discipline VARCHAR(100),
        [Event] VARCHAR(100),
        Rank INT,
        [Team/NOC] VARCHAR(100),
        Gold INT,
        Silver INT,
        Bronze INT,
        Total INT,
        [Rank by Total] INT
    ) AS [result]
GROUP BY
    NOC;

source:
# Import necessary libraries
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# Set up Spark session with Azure Data Lake Storage configurations
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("Read CSV") \
    .config("fs.azure.account.auth.type.<your_account_name>.dfs.core.windows.net", "OAuth") \
    .config("fs.azure.account.oauth.provider.type.<your_account_name>.dfs.core.windows.net", "org.apache.hadoop.fs.azurebfs.oauth2.ClientCredsTokenProvider") \
    .config("fs.azure.account.oauth2.client.id.<your_account_name>.dfs.core.windows.net", "<your_client_id>") \
    .config("fs.azure.account.oauth2.client.secret.<your_account_name>.dfs.core.windows.net", "<your_client_secret>") \
    .config("fs.azure.account.oauth2.client.endpoint.<your_account_name>.dfs.core.windows.net", "https://login.microsoftonline.com/<your_tenant_id>/oauth2/token") \
    .getOrCreate()

# Read the CSV file from Azure Data Lake Storage
csv_file_path = "abfss://newsynapsefilesys@newsynapseadlsaccount.dfs.core.windows.net/raw-data/Data/sdData.csv"
df = spark.read.csv(csv_file_path, header=True, inferSchema=True)

# Perform the SQL query
df2 = spark.sql(
    "SELECT `Sale Type`, SUM(`Invoice Value`) AS total_invoice_value "
    "FROM sddata.nirenewal "
    "GROUP BY `Sale Type`"
)
display(df2)
df3 = spark.sql("select * from sddata.nirenewal where `Sale Type` =='Renewal'")

%%pyspark
df4 = spark.sql("select * from sddata.nirenewal where `Sale Type`=='Sales'")
df4.repartition(1)
df4.write.mode("overwrite").csv("/sdData/csvfile")
df4.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("/sdData/parquetfile")

df6 = spark.sql("select * from sddata.nirenewal where `Sales Group` == 'SALES'")
df6.repartition(1)
df6.write.mode("overwrite").csv('/sdData/csvfile',header=True)
df6.write.mode("overwrite").parquet('/sdData/parquetfile')

%%pyspark
df1 = spark.sql("select * from sddata.nirenewal where `Sale Type` == 'New Subscription'")
df1.repartition(1)
df1.write.mode("overwrite").csv('/sdData/csvfile', header=True)
